body:
For two teamdrives the problem with this is that even though `drive1` and `drive2` are pointing to the same drive account, rclone things they are different and won't sever side copy things between them.

For one drive with the `--drive-shared-with-me` flag, the flag applies to both instances of the drive backend so this fails too.

To fix this needs the constraint relaxing that remotes must be identical for server side copy.  However rclone needs to know that both drives belong to the same "account" otherwise the server side copy will fail (or maybe it won't - not sure!).

Perhaps, if when configuring the user account you see all the team drives that the user has access to instead of having to configure a team drive independently.

rclone copy drive1:/td1/folder drive1:/td2/folder

thank you

> Perhaps, if when configuring the user account you see all the team drives that the user has access to instead of having to configure a team drive independently.
> 
> rclone copy drive1:/td1/folder drive1:/td2/folder
> 
> thank you

Yes that is a good idea that has occurred to me in the past too.

It would make the drive backend quite a bit more complicated, but if the directory structure started with some synthetic directories

- drive
    - normal drive files
- teamdrives
    - teamdrive1
    - teamdrive2
- sharedWithMe

That would fix the problem quite easily.

It would be hard work in the drive backend though...

Hello! this is very interesting. Is there any progress on this?
a greeting!

> Hello! this is very interesting. Is there any progress on this?

Not at the moment :-)  Would you like to help?

Hi, how can I help you?

I have experience in python.

Regards

> Hi, how can I help you?
> 
> I have experience in python.

If you'd like to work on the code, then I suggest you check out the rclone code, get it building then take a look at the `backend/drive/drive.go` code.

Firstly I would experiment with relaxing this constraint

https://github.com/ncw/rclone/blob/a6c28a5faa076d829c2ed330bf994b665763def7/fs/operations/operations.go#L269

Comment out the `&& SameConfig(src.Fs(), f)` and see if you can make it work.

issue.title: Add Type as field to FS to properly check for server side copy

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
#### What is the purpose of this change?
Check better for Serverside copy support by checking the Fs type and not the remote name


#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?
https://github.com/ncw/rclone/issues/2728

issue.title: Add ServerSideAcrossConfig Flag and check for it

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
#### What is the purpose of this change?
Add a fs.Feature to display that the remote can copy between configs and add a check for this


#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?
https://github.com/ncw/rclone/issues/2728

issue.title: gdrive server-side copy results in 404 errors

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Reference thread:

https://forum.rclone.org/t/gdrive-to-gdrive-error-404-file-not-found/9621/10

When syncing two different gdrive remotes, i'm seeing 404 errors coming in the api and failures.  When I disable the server-side copy the sync works correctly using "--disable copy".

`rclone sync robgs:cloudp/12el63s90885tg9u16iea5vtps/ao2c93qnjv533s8eoufko2p264/o59hc3g2a6qalng7k8mpmql28c pinagd:cloudp/12el63s90885tg9u16iea5vtps/ao2c93qnjv533s8eoufko2p264/o59hc3g2a6qalng7k8mpmql28c -vv --log-file=test.log --dump-bodies `


I've run this with dump bodies just to see where the errors are coming from and here is the 404 and the info leading up to it.

